name: Hello! Need help with a Wizard/Bard
author: Skeleton Pope

posts.author: Skeleton Pope
posts.content:
Hello builders!
Long time lurker here who has been following your excellent builds and guides as long as they've been up but I have never posted something of my own.

So I'm replaying my favorite PW (World of Greyhawk) as I want to finally see everything that giant module has to offer. I've been playing around with a variety of builds and decided I'd like to make my own as a fun experience.

This is the Iron Scholar, I'd like some help optimizing him and to see if anything isn't working properly as I haven't actually built this guy in game. This is what I have so far and Im just looking for thoughts and fresh eyes to see if I made any mistakes:

(Bard Song+EMA+Fullplate+Tower+Armor skin+Tumble) (technically +2 from curse song)

Highest possible AC (+5 Environment): 74
(Buffed dex/tower shield/plate/armorskin/tumble: 32 +20 Shield/EMA, +20 Dodge (5 EMA/5 Bardsong/5 Boots/1 MA/4 Haste), curse song -2 to enemy)

I took a bit of inspiration from Steel and faith by Mick Dagger and Draconic Arcanist by Maximillion Kane as both have played on World of Greyhawk and are amazing builders. I think he came out pretty solid, his biggest weakness is low HP for a melee focused guy but he has great AC, nearly Permanent bard song/curse song, and a full complement of undispellable wizard spells. I frontloaded the bard to squeeze out another BAB and the save the wizard bonus feats for epics when I need them most. I think he came out suprisingly playable, early levels he can whack with a morningstar, abuse taunt+expertise and summon using World of Greyhawks enhanced summons. His power dips a bit in early epics but I think he finishes really strong 30-40 which will be a long haul. Its really nice to have all the good skills and still have some left over, and since song is both undispellable and I have 1600 rounds available per rest I think I can confidently include it in all my calculations.

I took Epic Mage Armor because +5 is the cap in World of Greyhawk and I love having gear options outside of trying to optimize my AC. It really helps to flexible in what I can equip and still keep my most important defensive stat unhurt.

So, does anyone have any thoughts or suggestions? I realize this is a little more complete than what most requests come out as but I am not confident in my building skills and want to make sure hes on the up and up.

posts.content: Had a thought earlier that getting wizard 7 might be a better way to go as you can still get a tumble dump at 12 with bard.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Welcome Skeleton Pope!  It's an interesting concept.  It's tough when you're stat-strapped.

Bard 16 gives the ability to cast level 6 spells (you need a total CHA score of 22 though) so your current spread only allows you to cast up to level 4.  It's not too big of a deal as there is a lot overlap between the Bard and Wizard spells lists at level 5 and 6, with the major gaps being Mass Heal, Dirge.  The other gap is not being able to cast an Extended War Cry in the level 5 slot.

Also, you only have a total of 160 rounds of music (song is only 10 rounds) for both buffing and cursing so you do have to be more diligent in song use.  You can't take Lasting Inspiration because it requires 20 Bard levels.

So here are quick suggestions but most involve some sort of tradeoff.  I may have more when I get more time to mull on this.

1.  Replace Lasting Inspiration with one of the following:
  • Great Charisma to get access to level 5 spells and extended level 4 bard spells
  • Lingering Song to give you a 15 round song
  • Toughness to get an extra 40 HP
  • Silent Spell to give you extra castings of True Strike (to help your AB) with only a 1 level penalty (it can't be Extended)
2.  Replace Improved Knockdown with one of the following:
  • Toughness to get an extra 40 HP if not chosen above
  • Weapon Proficiency Martial and choose a more effective weapon - if you pick Longsword it will help if you use Tenser's

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Demos, why are you suggesting replacing Lasting Inspiration (100-round song) with Lingering Song (15-round song)?

Aha! I just looked in the wiki, and Lasting Inspiration requires 20 levels of Bard. That answers that question.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: WoG has a modified version of "Tenser's Transformation" Demos, he doesn't need the focus in longsword but of course is a superior and more supported weapon than the Morningstar. What i do not see in there is "Empower Spell" which is vital for any spell-slinger, in my opinion at least. And if he wants to "Still" his high level Bard spells he does needs 16 Charisma.

posts.author: Skeleton Pope
posts.content: Yeah unfortunately Lasting requires 20 bard. I do think it lets me sneak in enough charisma for level 6 bard spells. I can't believe I also forgot empower, thats a staple. I think replacing improved knockdown with empower, and swapping lasting for lingering will still give enough bardsong for it to matter.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Replace Expertise with "Martial Weaapons" & put the Focuses into Longsword. Replace "IKD" with "Empower". Switch 2 STR to CHA and you are good.
